title: Apigee - Provision API hub using a script
abstract:
# Apigee - Provision API hub using a script
**    Preview    — Apigee API hub ** This feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
This document describes how to provision API hub using a script.
content:
## Summary of steps
The provisioning steps are as follows:
- Verify that you have met the [API hub prerequisites](/apigee/docs/api-hub/prerequisites) .
- [Enable APIs](/apigee/docs/api-hub/provision-cli#enable-apis) .  Apigee requires you to enable several Google Cloud APIs.
- [Download](#download) (or create) the script.
- [Run](#run) the script.
- Wait 30 minutes for provisioning to complete.## Provisioning steps
To provision API hub using a script:
- Download the script:- Navigate to [provision-apihub.sh](https://github.com/apigee/registry-experimental/blob/main/apihub/provision-apihub.sh) .
- Right-click **Raw** and then click **Save Link As** .
- Click **Save** .
- Run the script:```
provision-apihub.sh -u USER_EMAIL -p PROJECT_ID -l RUNTIME_LOCATION -r KEY_RING_NAME -k KEY_NAME
```Where:- is a Google Cloud account with billing enabled.
- is a Google Cloud project.
- is chosen location for the instance.
- is the [CMEK](/kms/docs/cmek) key  ring name.
- is the [CMEK](/kms/docs/cmek) key name.
- Wait 30 minutes for provisioning to complete.## Next steps
See [Next steps](/apigee/docs/api-hub/next-steps) for some tips  on how to get started using API hub.
